nodes.text: Tejha Larel was a painting of Lady Cjaalysce, a colonist on Socorro. The name "Tejha Larel" is Old Corellian for "Undying Love." It was a painting that showed her grief after her lover, Iann Doaba, exiled himself into the desert. Pret Swain's father came into possession of this painting, and passed it onto Benoni Ulte. Iann Doaba's spirit clung to the painting, and his shadow could be observed haunting it.
